alert.note: Alert for Northern Ventura County Mountains; Southern Ventura County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 20 at 4:41AM PDT until March 22 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 1 to 3 feet above 6000 feet, 10-20 inches between 5000 and 6000 feet and 2-10 inches between 4000 and 5000 feet are possible. Winds could gust as high as 80 mph on Tuesday. * WHERE...Southern Ventura County Mountains and Northern Ventura County Mountains. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will mainly be between 4500 and 6500 feet Tuesday before crashing to near or below 4000 feet Tuesday evening into Wednesday. Interstate 5 through Tejon Pass could recieve up to 3 inches of snowfall Tuesday night and Wednesday, possibly causing travel delays.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northern Ventura County Mountains; Southern Ventura County Mountains
